nodes.content: Systemic therapy, Adenocarcinoma (NSCL-K 1 of 5) or Squamous Cell Carcinoma (NSCL-K 2 of 5)
Preferred: Fam-trastuzumab deruxtecan-nxki or Other Recommended: Ado-trastuzumab emtansine

tree_references.description: Systemic therapy for Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Subsequent systemic therapy options and HER2 protein overexpression treatment options
Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis
Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease

footnotes.label: nn
footnotes.content: Principles of Molecular and Biomarker Analysis (NSCL-H).

footnotes.label: rr
footnotes.content: Molecular or Biomarker-Directed Therapy for Advanced or Metastatic Disease (NSCL-J).

footnotes.label: iii
footnotes.content: Monitoring During Initial Therapy: Response assessment after 2 cycles, then every 2–4 cycles with CT of known or high-risk sites of disease (eg, chest, abdomen, pelvis) with or without contrast or when clinically indicated. Timing of CT scans within Guidelines parameters is a clinical decision.

footnotes.label: jjj
footnotes.content: In general, 4 cycles of initial systemic therapy (ie, with carboplatin or cisplatin) are administered prior to maintenance therapy. However, if patient is tolerating therapy well, consideration can be given to continue to 6 cycles.

footnotes.label: kkk
footnotes.content: Monitoring During Subsequent Therapy or Maintenance Therapy: Response assessment with CT of known or high-risk sites of disease (eg, chest, abdomen, pelvis) with or without contrast every 6–12 weeks. Timing of CT scans within Guidelines parameters is a clinical decision.

footnotes.label: rrr
footnotes.content: For HER2 protein overexpression (IHC3+) treatment options, see NSCL-K 4 of 5.

footnotes.label: sss
footnotes.content: For oncogenic or likely oncogenic HER2 mutations, refer to definitions at oncokb.org.
